member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC
member.summary: Class provides information about Auto Tool Changer.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance of this class based on current ATC type configured on the machine.

remarks.para: If the machine is equipped with Random ATC Type then the instance will be created to be used for Random ATC type.
If the machine is equipped with Fixed ATC Type then the instance will be created to be used for Fixed Address ATC type.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of this class at the specified ATC type. In addition to library name, the provided logging name will be used for logging all function calls
member.param: Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.CancelTool
member.summary: Clear the entire ATC Tool Pot table.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the CancelTool mothod.
Dim objcatc As CMCMDAPI.CATC Try objcatc = New CMCMDAPI.CATC(Me.atcComboATCType.SelectedValue) objcatc.CancelTool() Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CATC", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CATC", ex.Message) End Try
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.UnRegisterToolPot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Un-register a tool at the specified pot number.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the UnRegisterToolPot mothod.
Dim objcatc As CMCMDAPI.CATC Try objcatc = New CMCMDAPI.CATC(Me.atcComboATCType.SelectedValue) objcatc.UnRegisterToolPot(CInt(Me.atcCMDPotNumber.Text)) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CATC", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CATC", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Pot number where the current registered tool to be un-registered
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: After the tool is un-registered at the specified pot, a 'NONE' will be displayed at the specified pot number in the ATC Tool Pot table.
member.Figure: POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.RegisterToolPot(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.overloads: This function has 2 overload methods to register tool to at the specified pot number.
member.summary: Register a tool at the specified pot number.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot mothod.
Private Sub atcButtonRegister_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles atcButtonRegister.Click Dim objcatc As CMCMDAPI.CATC Try objcatc = New CMCMDAPI.CATC(Me.atcComboATCType.SelectedValue) objcatc.RegisterToolPot(CInt(Me.atcCMDPotNumber.Text), CInt(Me.atcCMDToolNumber.Text)) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CATC", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CATC", ex.Message) End Try End Sub
member.param: Pot number where a tool will be registered to.
Tool number to be registered
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: This method will register a tool at the specified pot number without using any tool attribute such as a tool with large diameter.
member.Figure: POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.RegisterToolPot(System.Int32,System.Int32,Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttributeEnum)
member.summary: Register a tool at the specified pot number with tool attribute
member.example:
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot mothod.
Dim objcatc As CMCMDAPI.CATC Try objcatc = New CMCMDAPI.CATC(Me.atcComboATCType.SelectedValue) objcatc.RegisterToolPot(CInt(Me.atcCMDPotNumber.Text), CInt(Me.atcCMDToolNumber.Text), Me.atcComboToolAttribute.SelectedValue) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CATC", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CATC", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Pot number where a tool will be registered to.
Tool number to be registered
Tool attribute of the tool to be registered. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttributeEnum enumeration.
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: This method will register a tool including tool attribute at the specified pot number such as a tool with large diameter. To register a pot as dummy tool pot, register a valid tool number with an attribute of ToolAttributeEnum.DummyTool.
member.Figure: POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.SetActualTool(System.Int32,Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttributeEnum)
member.summary: Set a tool number as actual tool for Randdom/Fixed Address ATC Type.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the SetActualTool mothod.
Dim objcatc As CMCMDAPI.CATC Try objcatc = New CMCMDAPI.CATC(Me.atcComboATCType.SelectedValue) objcatc.SetActualTool(CInt(Me.atcCMDToolNumber.Text), Me.atcComboToolAttribute.SelectedValue) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CATC", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CATC", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Tool number to be set as Actual Tool. Setting value of zero will set Actual tool to NONE
Tool attribute of the tool to be set as Actual tool in Random Adress ATC Type only. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttributeEnum enumeration.
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks:
For ATC Fixed Address: This method will set a registered tool as the Actual Tool. Tool attribute is ignored if specified as part of tool number. The tool attribute will be the attribute of current registered tool number if any.
For ATC Radnom Address: This method will set a non-registered tool number as the Actual Tool. Tool attribute can be set as part of the tool number.
member.Figure:
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table
Actual Tool (ACT) in Fixed Address ATC Type
Actual Tool (ACT) in Random Address ATC Type

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.SetNextTool(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set a registered tool number in ATC table as Next Tool
member.example:
This example shows how to call the SetNextTool mothod.
Dim objcatc As CMCMDAPI.CATC Try objcatc = New CMCMDAPI.CATC(Me.atcComboATCType.SelectedValue) objcatc.SetNextTool(CInt(Me.atcCMDToolNumber.Text)) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CATC", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CATC", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: A registered tool number to be set as Next Tool
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: For machine equipped with Random Address ATC type, Next Tool or Return Pot number can only be set if the other is set to NONE.
member.Figure:
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table
Next Tool (NXT) in Fixed Address ATC Type
Next Tool (NXT) in Random Address ATC Type

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC.SetReturnPot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set return pot number for machine equipped with ATC Random Address
member.example:
This example shows how to call the SetReturnPot mothod.
Dim objcatc As CMCMDAPI.CATC Try objcatc = New CMCMDAPI.CATC(Me.atcComboATCType.SelectedValue) objcatc.SetReturnPot(CInt(Me.atcCMDToolNumber.Text)) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CATC", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CATC", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Pot number to be set
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system

remarks.para: For machine equipped with ATC Random magazine, Next Tool or Return Pot number can only be set if the other is set to NONE.

member.Figure:
POT NO./TOOL NO. TABLE - ATC Tool Pot Table - POT NO.
Return Pot number in Random Address ATC Type.

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC2
member.summary: Class provides information about Auto Tool Changer for 8-Digits Tool ID specification.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC2.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance of this class.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC2.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of this class. In addition to library name, the provided logging name will be used for logging all function calls
member.param: Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC2.RegisterToolPot(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.overloads: This function has 2 overload methods to register tool/pot for Fixed/Random Address ATC.

summary.para: Fixed Address ATC: Register a tool at the specified pot number. A combination of group number and serial number are assigned and to be used as tool number for a pot.

member.example:
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot mothod.
objATC2.RegisterToolPot(CInt(txtATC2.PotNoValue.Text), CInt(txtATC2.GroupNoValue.Text), CInt(txtATC2.SerialNoValue.Text), CBool(chkATC2.DummyTool.SelectValue),txtATC2.ToolNameValue.Text ) End Sub
member.param: Pot number where a tool will be registered to. Pot number is 1 to the maximum pot number.

Group number to be assigned to this pot. Group number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool group number is 1 to 9999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 ON. Tool group number is 1 to 99999999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 OFF

Serial number to be assigned to this pot. Serial number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool serial number is 1 to 9999. Tool name can have a maximum 16 characters composed of single-space capital A-Z, 0-9.
Optionally, a DUMMY tool is registered into this pot. True if it is a DUMMY Tool, otherwise false.
Optionally, a tool name can be assinged to this pot. Tool name will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. The first character of tool name cannot be '.' or '-'.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.Figure:
TOOL DATA - TOOL ID INFORMATION - POT TOOL TABLE - POT - TOOL SET
Fixed ATC

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC2.UnRegisterToolPot(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Fixed Address ATC: Un-register a tool at the specified pot number.
Random Address ATC: Un-register a tool at the specified tool and pot number.

member.example:
This example shows how to call the UnRegisterToolPot mothod.
objATC2.UnRegisterToolPot(CInt(txtATC2.PotNoValue.Text))
member.param: Pot number where the current registered tool to be un-registered
Tool number currently registered in the specified Pot number. For ATC Random only
Specified wheter this operation is for Random Address ATC type or not. Default value is false
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.Figure:
TOOL DATA - TOOL ID INFORMATION - POT TOOL TABLE - POT - TOOL SET - TOOL NO. CLEAR
Fixed ATC
Random ATC
member.history: [Lhuynh] 11/28/2007 Created [Lhuynh] 10/1/2008 revise to support Random ATC

Memory Random ATC: Set tool kind at the specified tool number.

member.example:
This example shows how to call the SetToolKind mothod.

member.param: Tool/Pot number. Tool number is within 1 to maximum tool number. Pot number is within 1 to maximum pot number.
Tool Kind. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolKindEnum enumeration.

Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CATC2.RegisterToolPot(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)

summary.para: Memory Random ATC: Register a tool at the specified pot number. A combination of group number and serial number are assigned and to be used as tool number for a pot.

member.example:
This example shows how to call the RegisterToolPot mothod.
objATC2.RegisterToolPot(CInt(txtATC2.ToolNoValue.Text), CInt(txtATC2.PotNoValue.Text), CInt(txtATC2.GroupNoValue.Text), CInt(txtATC2.SerialNoValue.Text), CBool(chkATC2.DummyTool.SelectValue),txtATC2.ToolNameValue.Text ) End Sub
member.param: Tool number to be registered into the specified pot number. Tool number is 1 to the maximum tool number.
Pot number where a tool will be registered to. Pot number is 1 to the maximum pot number.

Group number to be assigned to this pot. Group number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool group number is 1 to 9999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 ON. Tool group number is 1 to 99999999 in case of NC OP. bit No.57 bit1 OFF

Serial number to be assigned to this pot. Serial number will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. Tool serial number is 1 to 9999. Tool name can have a maximum 16 characters composed of single-space capital A-Z, 0-9.
Optionally, a DUMMY tool is registered into this pot. True if it is a DUMMY Tool, otherwise false.
Optionally, a tool name can be assinged to this pot. Tool name will be ignored if tool is registered as DUMMY TOOL. The first character of tool name cannot be '.' or '-'.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.Figure:
TOOL DATA - TOOL ID INFORMATION - POT TOOL TABLE - TOOL - TOOL SET
Random ATC

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CBase
member.summary: It is a base class for all classes of Data API. All classes in DATA-API will be derived from this class to handle error handling, logging service, and other services for internal data structure of this library ONLY.
member.remarks: It should not be create directly by any client application.

Derived class name.
Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.FeatureSetEnum
member.summary: Feature Set enumeration

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ControlTypeEnum
member.summary: Control type enumeration

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.CarrierStatusEnum
member.summary: Represents status of Tool ID carrier

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.CarrierStatusEnum.No
member.summary: Data carrier is not available

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.CarrierStatusEnum.Yes
member.summary: Data carrier is available

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.CarrierStatusEnum.COMP_Write
member.summary: Forcibly write data to the data carrier without verifying the tool number.

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolLifeStatusEnum
member.summary: Represents tool life status for 8-Digits Tool ID specification.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolLifeStatusEnum.OK
member.summary: Tool life status is in good condition.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolLifeStatusEnum.NG
member.summary: Tool life status is not in good condition - NG2( User)

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolKindEnum
member.summary: Represents tool kind for 8-Digits Tool ID specification.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolKindEnum.None
member.summary: Regular Tool

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolKindEnum.Large
member.summary: Large Tool

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolKindEnum.Heavy
member.summary: Heavy Tool

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolKindEnum.UAxisLarge
member.summary: U-axis Large diameter tool. This tool kind is only valid if specification of U-Axis is active.

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttribute2Enum
member.summary: Represents tool attributes for 8-Digits Tool ID specification.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttribute2Enum.None
member.summary: Tool without an attribute

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttribute2Enum.DummyTool
member.summary: A dummy tool. A tool that is assigned next to a large diameter tool to prevent colliding with the adjacent tools.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ToolAttribute2Enum.NoTool
member.summary: No tool

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum
member.summary: MID Block restart options.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum.None
member.summary: No return to the middle block

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum.MC_POSIT_X
member.summary: return to the middle block for X axis

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum.MC_POSIT_Y
member.summary: return to the middle block for Y axis

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum.MC_POSIT_Z
member.summary: return to the middle block for Z axis

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum.SlideHold
member.summary: (STOP) Slide Hold

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.AxisMovementOrderEnum
member.summary: List of axes movement order when sequence restart is performed.
member.history: [Lhuynh] 11/5/2007 Created OCJ DOCUMENT ENUMERATE IN OPPOSITE DIRECTION. USE NC HMI ORDER

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.AxisMovementOrderEnum.None
member.summary: All 3 axes move into position simultaneously

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum
member.summary: List of available NC panel group mode.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum.OperationMode
member.summary: Operation mode - NC is under either Auto/MDI/Manual mode.
member.remarks:
Auto/MDI/Manual mode cannot be changed by this command, but the screen can be changed while NC in one of these modes.
For example, screen can be changed from ACTUAL POSITION to MAIN PROGRAM.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum.ProgramMode
member.summary: In this mode program and data files can be edited, input/output, displayed, and deleted

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum.ParameterMode
member.summary: In this mode the parameter data necessary for numerical control can be set, changed, an displayed.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum.ZeroSetMode
member.summary: In this mode the zero offset data and zero offset shift data which define a program coordinate system can be set, changed, or checked.

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum.ToolDataSettingMode
member.summary: In this mode the tool offset data, nose radius compensation data, tool shape data, and load monitor data can be set, changed, or displayed

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum.MacManMode
member.summary: In this mode the machining management function can be used.

member.name: T:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ATCTypesEnum
member.summary: Represents type of ATC

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ATCTypesEnum.RandomMemory
member.summary: Random Memory ATC Type. When a tool is going to be returned to the magazine, NC will select the return pot automatically

member.name: F:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.ATCTypesEnum.FixedAddress
member.summary: Fixed Adress ATC Type. When a tool is going to be returned to the magazine, it will return to the same location as it is getting from.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine.InputMDI(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Command MDI string into the MDI buffer.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the InputMDI method.
Dim objmac As Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine Try objmac = New Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMachine objmac.InputMDI(Txt_mdicommand.Text) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("Cmachine", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("Cmachine", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: MDI command
member.remarks: After the MDI command string is inserted into the NC MDI buffer screen, a cycle start from control is needed to execute the MDI command.
member.Figure: MDI - G1X100 is inserted to NC MDI buffer. A cycle start is needed to carry out the MDI command.

member.summary: Class provides MOP Tool operations.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMOPTool.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of this class. In addition to library name, the provided logging name will be used for logging all function calls
member.param: Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMOPTool.Edit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a MOP Tool Data number with the specified tool number and its associated class number if it does not exist in the MOP Data table.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the Edit mothod.
Dim objccmop As CMCMDAPI.CMOPTool Try objccmop = New CMCMDAPI.CMOPTool objccmop.Edit(CLng(Me.mopCMDToolNumber.Text), CInt(Me.mopCMDClassNumber.Text)) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("cmop", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("cmop", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Tool number. Valid tool number is ranging from 1 - 999.
Classification number for this tool number. Valid class numbers is from 0 to 9.
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: NC will assigned a MOP Tool data number for each tool number and its classification number automatically based on the current MOP Tool Data list such that the order of tool numbers and its classification numbers are displayed in ascending order. Therefore, a MOP Tool Data number assigned for a pair of tool number and its classification number could be changed if there is a deletion or addition to the MOP Tool Data table. For example, if tool number 45-0 is removed from the MOP Tool Data list, then tool 50-0 will has a MOP Tool Data number 4.
member.Figure: MOP TOOL - TOOL DATA SETING - ENTRY TOOL LIST - list of all MOP Tool Data and its associated tool number with classification nunber.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CMOPTool.Delete(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Delete the current tool number and its associated class number in the MOP Tool Data table.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the Delete mothod.
Dim objccmop As CMCMDAPI.CMOPTool Try objccmop = New CMCMDAPI.CMOPTool objccmop.Delete(CLng(Me.mopCMDToolNumber.Text), CInt(Me.mopCMDClassNumber.Text)) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("cmop", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("cmop", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Tool number. Valid tool number is ranging from 1 - 999.
Classification number for this tool number. Valid class numbers is from 0 to 9.
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: NC will assigned a MOP Tool data number for each tool number and its classification number automatically based on the current MOP Tool Data list such that the order of tool numbers and its classification numbers are displayed in ascending order. Therefore, a MOP Tool Data number assigned for a pair of tool number and its classification number could be changed if there is a deletion or addition to the MOP Tool Data table. For example, if tool number 45-0 is removed from the MOP Tool Data list, then tool 50-0 will has a MOP Tool Data number 4.
member.Figure: MOP TOOL - TOOL DATA SETING - ENTRY TOOL LIST - list of all MOP Tool Data and its associated tool number with classification nunber.

member.param: Logging Name. Globally, The logging name will be combined with library name as the logging name for all logging message.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.SelectMainProgram(System.String,System.String,System.String,Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.FileReadModeEnum)
member.summary: Load the specified part program file into NC. Optionally, it can also load sub program file name, or run a particular program name.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the SelectMainProgram mothod.
Dim objcprogram As CMCMDAPI.CProgram Try objcprogram.SelectMainProgram(prog1.Text, prog2.Text, prog3.Text, prog4.Text) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CMD program", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CMD Program", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Main program file name to be loaded into NC
Sub program file name for this main program
Name of program in the main program file to be run. Name must be starting with an O and a maximum length of characters is 5.
File read mode applied to main program file
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: All files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system. In order to load program with B or S method, NC Optional parameter WORD # 11 must be set to 1 for B method, or 2 for S method, respectively.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.CancelMainProgram
member.summary: Cancel main program currently loaded in NC. Machine must be not in Execute Mode.
member.example:
This example shows how to call CancelMainProgram method.
Try objcprogram.CancelMainProgram() Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CMD program", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CMD Program", ex.Message) End Try
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.SelectScheduleProgram(System.String)
member.summary: Load the specified schedule part program file into NC.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the SelectScheduleProgram mothod.
Dim objcprogram As CMCMDAPI.CProgram Try objcprogram.SelectScheduleProgram(prog1.Text) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CMD program", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CMD Program", ex.Message) End Try
member.param: Schedule program file name to be loaded into NC
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: All files should be located in the default MD1 folder of the OSP system.

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CProgram.ReturnSearch(System.String,Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.AxisMovementOrderEnum,Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Perform the return search operation. The return search and sequence restart functions are used to restart automatic operation after taking necessary measures like changing a tool if automatic operation is interrupted due to problems such as tool breakage. The return search function processes the program up to the specified sequence while moving the pointer.
For more information, please refer to Machining Center Operation Manual - Section 5 Automatic Operation - Return Search and Sequence Restart
member.example:
This example shows how to call ReturnSearch method.
Dim strSequence as String Dim intOrderNumber as Integer Try objCMDProgram.RestartSequence(strSequence, intRepeatnumber.ToString, Convert.ToSByte(enAxisMovementOrder), Convert.ToSByte(enMidBlockRestart), intNumberRelativeBlock) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("CMD program", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("CMD Program", ex.Message) End Try

param.name: strSequence
param.para: Sequence number or block counter. Sequence restart starts with N + 5 sequence numbers. For example, N1234 is a sequence name.

The sequence name or block counter input field can accept the input of asterisk “*”. The asterisk “*” means the previously executed block counter value (displayed on the title bar of the screen). Further, + or – sign can be used for addition or subtraction of the block counter value.

Ex. If you input “*–2” when the previous counter value is 415, the program return to the block No. 413. If a block counter is input instead of a sequence name, the RESTART pop-up window does not display the relative number of blocks from the sequence name to the return point or the number of repetitions. Set the other items in the same manner as the items displayed by the input of a sequence name.

member.param: Specified the axis movement order when sequence restart is perfromed. Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.AxisMovementOrderEnum enumeration.

param.name: enMidBlockRestart
param.para: Enables sequence restart from the point where the operation was interrupted. In addition, the order of axis movements to return to the sequence restart point can be set by assigning the priority to the axes.Values of parameter come from the Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.MIDBlockRestartEnum enumeration.
For more information on MID-BLOCK RESTART please refer to the OSP-P200M Special Functions Manual No. 1 - SECTION 4 UPGRADED SEQUENCE RESTART FUNCTION (MID-BLOCK RESTART FUNCTION)

member.param: Specified the relative number of blocks (A NUMBER OF BLOCK BEYOND SEQ. NAME) from sequence name to the return point.
Applied only when a sequence name is specified to the first parameter.

The “order” when designating a sequence name is a value that specifies, in cases where the same sequence number occurs a number of times in the same part program, the position of the sequence number from which the sequence is to be restarted. It indicates which occurrence of the sequence number - starting from the first block of the part program - is the relevant one.
Applied only when a sequence name is specified to the first parameter.
member.remarks:
The Return Search operation is only valid in AUTO MODE operation. In other mode, no operation is carried out or ignore. An error occurs if return search is executed during the execution of a schedule or main program.
The Axis Movement Order and Mid Block Restart parameters will be ignored in the operation if Spec code number 11 bit 6 is not enabled.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.history: [Lhuynh] 11/05/2007 Created Support in MCMCAPI.exe version 1.0.2.1, MC.dll 41.1.0.0

member.name: M:Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CViews.ChangeScreen(Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum,System.String)
member.summary: Allow to change current screen on NC to different screen by specified the panel group name and screen name.
member.example:
This example shows how to call the ChangeScreen mothod.
Me.Cmb_ChangeScreen.DataSource = System.Enum.GetValues(GetType(Okuma.CMCMDAPI.Enumerations.PanelGroupEnum)) Private Sub cmd_ChangeScreen_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles cmd_ChangeScreen.Click Dim objview As Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CViews Dim int_panalenum As Int32 Try int_panalenum = CInt(Cmb_ChangeScreen.SelectedItem) objview = New Okuma.CMCMDAPI.CommandAPI.CViews objview.ChangeScreen(int_panalenum, txt_screenname.Text) Catch ae As ApplicationException doError("Cview", ae.Message) Catch ex As Exception doError("Cview", ex.Message) End Try End Sub
member.param: Panel group name where the screen resides.
Screen name to be displayed as active screen on NC
member.exception: Thrown when function failes to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system
member.remarks: If no screen name is specified, then the previous active screen or default screen name of the specified panel group name will be displayed.
